Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw at least two different habitats (one land and one water environment), such as a forest and a lake.
The student can include a variety of living things in each habitat, like trees, grasses, and animals such as squirrels and fish.
The student can make comparisons between the different types of living things they have drawn in each habitat.
The student can show patterns in plant and animal diversity across the two habitats by illustrating the different species present.
The student can include labels or captions to describe the living things and habitats drawn, to provide extra information.
The student can organize their drawing to clearly display the different plants and animals in each habitat.
